original_title: Sri Lanka clears 135MW solar power JV with NTPC India
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has given the clearance to build a 135 MegaWatt solar power plant in Sampur, Trincomalee as a joint venture between state-run Ceylon Electricity Board and India’s National Thermal Power Corporation.
The 114.5 million US dollar plant is expected to be completed in two stages in 2024 and 2025.
The first stage will be a 42.5 million dollar 50MW solar farm. The second is 72 million US dollar, 85MW farm.

A 23.6 million dollar, 40 kilometre transmission line will be built from Sampoor to Kappalthure for stage one power export and a 76 kilometre, 42 million dollar 220kV line from Kappalthure to New Habarana for the second stage.
The solar plant is in the same location near Trincomalee port where a 500MW coal plant with NTPC was planned earlier.
There was no information on the feed in tariffs. (Colombo/Mar28/.2023)
